isis.stitle: BRAKE COMPONENTS: This Service Manual Section should be used for reference only. For more current service information on all components go to the Bendix website from the ISIS Suppliers menu and refer to the Service Data Sheets. - INVERSION VALVE (BENDIX SR-1) - REASSEMBLE

svcproc.title: REASSEMBLE
svcproc.para:
Prior to reassembly of the SR-1 inversion valve, lubricate all O-rings, O-ring grooves, piston bores and metal-to-metal moving surfaces with the silicone base lubricant packaged in the repair kit or Item 3 in
LUBRICANT SPECIFICATIONS
.
The torque values listed in the assembly procedure are assembly torque values and can be expected to lighten following assembly. Do not retighten following initial assembly.

step1.para: Assemble check valve, valve spring guide and valve spring, and insert them in body.
Apply pipe sealant to socket head pipe plug and install it in the body. Tighten to 130 to 170 in-lbs. (15 to 19 N• m).
Place inlet and exhaust valve assembly into valve body.
Install exhaust diaphragm in exhaust cover.
Position exhaust cover on body and secure cover with two screws. Tighten screws to 20 to 30 in-lbs. (2.3 to 3.4 N• m).
Place inlet exhaust valve in body and install valve spring and valve stop.
Install O-ring on the cap nut and install the cap nut in body. Tighten to 100 to 125 in-lbs. (11 to 14 N• m).
Position small and large O-rings on small diameter piston and insert piston in body.
Install large and small O-rings on large diameter piston and insert the piston in body.
Position piston springs in their respective pistons.
Secure cover to body with four screws and lockwashers. Tighten four screws to 50 to 80 in-lbs. (5.7 to 9 N·m).
